DrunkSquirrel
1,394 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2021
Двойную порцию Кафки заказывали?

Адаптация это всегда непросто, а когда берёшься за классиков, то непросто вдвойне. Видимо поэтому разработчики из Ovid Works решили, что терять им нечего, и пошли на смелый шаг, отойдя от сюжета оригинала.

Перед нами "Превращение" Франца Кафки, и если вы читали повесть, то знаете, что геймплеем там особо не разживёшься (не от яблок же нам уворачиваться!), а потому авторы добавили сюда также и историю из романа "Процесс". Получилось метафорично, абсурдно, гротескно и мерзковато — то есть неожиданно хорошо.

Игроку достаётся роль Грегора Замзы, который переживёт своё превращение почти как Алиса в Стране чудес, став крохотным насекомым. В попытках разобраться с правилами мира жуков Грегор будет одновременно наблюдать за не менее странной историей своего приятеля Йозефа К. Он не менял ни вида, ни размера, но всё равно чувствует себя букашкой в бюрократической судебной системе. В игре есть и другие колоритные персонажи, и несмотря на то, что наша цель почти всегда будет заключаться в перемещении из точки в А в точку Б, не откажите себе в удовольствии остановиться и вслушаться в их разговоры.

Ползать по гигантскому миру людей и карикатурному миру жуков довольно непросто и увлекательно. Однако для меня фокус при прохождении всё равно сместился в сторону сюжета. Поэтому рекомендовать игру как платформер я бы не стал, но однозначно рекомендую её как пример замечательной адаптации, где всё на своём месте: и повествование, и дизайн, и геймплей, и музыка, и даже гадкие звуки ваших собственных лапок.
 
Zhareg
573 produits enregistrés
0
12 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
6.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 aout 2020
Стиму очень не хватает нейтральной оценки в рецензиях.
Но этой игре я скажу - скорее нет, чем да.
Почему так ? Да всё просто. За 6 часов её можно 2 раза пройти, собрать 24 из 26 ачивок , и забыть о ней.
Завязка игры интересна, но дальше... Всё очень скучно. Она линейна донельзя. Ну и естественно, в самый последний момент у нас есть выбор , который ни на что не влияет, ну , кроме финального ролика только. Да и сама подводка к выбору - она никакая. Как бы мы не проходили, что бы мы не делали- выбор только в финале. Одно из двух и всё. Да, есть записки, да есть аж один мимолётный ролик, намекающий на то, что именно происходит. Но сюжета нет. Есть сюжетная арка. Да, её нам рассказывают, но без какой либо подготовки. Хочется ли сопереживать главному герою и его друзьям? Нет. Потому что они - " картонки", без предыстории и без раскрытия. Да, в игре есть сатира на бюрократию, и даже она забавна, но в целом- пройдя игру , к ней нет смысла возвращаться ещё раз.
Да и даже в этой сатире есть спорный момент , хотя , это возможно огрехи программистов, которые делали игру. Но лазать по двум уровням под зацикленный диалоги... Ну, такое себе.
Но погодите - может быть геймплей спасает ситуацию? Нет. Не спасает. В " обучении" вам скажут что можно измазаться в липкой жидкости и начать ползать по стенам.... Ииии.... всё. По потолку всё равно ползать нельзя. За то что забираешься на потолок и падаешь с него , аж есть ачивка... Класс. А там , где нужно\ можно ползать по стенам - быстрее забраться с распрыжки.
С другой же стороны - тут спасает короткая продолжительность. Под конец игра начинает надоедать однообразием, на судьбы гг ( читай - на сюжет в целом ) - плевать, начинает одолевать скука... И игра заканчивается. В одном случае- закономерно, а в другом - оставляя игрока с вопросами.
В целом - эта игра пример того, что были полимеры, но их просто слили. Осталась только красивая оболочка.
Что мешало добавить больше сайдквестов для прохождения ? Тем более, что два примера есть. И я не считаю разветвленной системой то, что один и тот же уровень можно просто пробежать "тропкой" снизу или сверху, если что.
Что мешало добавить нелинейности в сюжет? Да и что мешало прописать хоть какой- то " бэкграунд" для истории? И судя по "мимолётному " ролику - попытки то были... Причём, как для истории глав героев, так и общества насекомых.
У вас всё равно 8 глав , учитывая пролог, и 3 часа геймплея...
Да в игре есть отсылки к Каффке , так и к другим писателям того времени, да даже к фильмам некоторым, как я понял. И это классно , но блин, этим не перекроешь другие огрехи. В остальном же - или будет продолжение в этой " вселенной" или же сама по себе игра пуста.
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation
Altivex
3
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
13.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 aout 2020
Metamorphosis – сюрреалистичная приключенческая игра вдохновлённая образами Кафки. В которой предстоит решать загадки, общаться с необычными, а порой и странными персонажами (жуками) и конечно же карабкаться, везде где это только возможно.

Люблю я начинать обзор с сюжета и этот обзор не будет исключением. Главный герой, просыпается как-то с похмелья и идёт искать друга и вот буквально пройдя одну комнату он обнаруживает, что всё становится большим, а он превратился в жука. Как вам такое?! Дальше мы уже не идём, а карабкаемся и попутно узнаём что вашего друга обвиняют в преступлении (в каком до селе не известно), а также чтобы вернуть человеческий облик нам надо попасть в Башню (главное жучье логово) и заслужить это право на обратное перевоплощение. Далее будут спойлеры которых по соображениям безопасности, тут не будет. Вообще сама игра навеяна образами и произведениями Кафки. Я лично не знаком с произведениями этого писателя, но вдруг, если кто-то знаком, играть будет веселее (так говорят). Пройдя всю игру, я в целом понял сюжет и его концовку (коих тут две), но только верхнюю её часть, но вот глубину мне кажется, понять не удалось. Но на самом деле это мелочи, так как по моим наблюдениям, сюжет строится в игре так, чтобы было понятно всем игрокам. Просто одни увидят свою картину, а другие кто приобщился к произведениям Кафки - другую.

Хочу рассказать о локациях, персонажах и наполненности игры. Действие игры происходит в начале XX века, по моим наблюдениям 20-30 годы, отсюда и тот антураж, который встречается в игре. Выглядит всё очень стильно, проработано, но немного по «детски», нет этого реализма что ли, но игра на это и не претендует. В игре 8 локаций и все они разнообразны, вам повстречаются такие места как «бар жуков», «деревня жуков», припортовый городок, очень большой стол адвоката, почтамт. Там всегда есть на что полюбоваться, куда забраться и что поисследовать.
На что я особо обратил внимание, так это диалоги персонажей, они очень интересно прописаны, в них очень много юмора и насущных проблем. Например мне встретился жук стендапер, который со сцены рассказывал анекдоты, также я повстречал путану и не одну (есть выбор - это приятно), мэра города который не чист на руку и т.д. Персонажей (жуков) в игре предостаточно и со всеми лучше провести диалог.

Пару слов, о графике, механики, геймплее и вообще о технической стороне игры. Как я уже писал выше, графика в игре немного «детская», но скорее всего это такой стиль, конечно хотелось бы больше реализма и детальности предметов, но я думаю картинка и сама суть игры взаимосвязаны. Единственное за что ухватилось уж слишком бурно моё внимание, так это на размеры жуков, они по моим наблюдениям размером в ладошку и когда мы ползаем около людей, они нас впритык не замечают.
Механика в игре не замысловатая, мы можем бегать, прыгать и карабкаться, когда найдём клей и оставим его на своих лапках. Всё это выглядит очень простенько, но зачем придумывать что-то лишнее, когда это работает. Очень приятные ощущения, когда карабкаешься по отвесной стене и наблюдаешь всё вверх ногами. Управление, удобное, не знаю, какие могут быть с ним проблемы. Приятно удивил также такой нюанс, как отсутствие багов. Есть только пару недочётов в локализации, где-то шрифт выходит за границы экрана, а где-то не переведён текст, но это встречается крайне редко.

С музыкальным сопровождением и звуками тут не всё однозначно. Она как бы есть, а как бы и нет. Пожалуй стоит пояснить. Она есть на заднем фоне, но ничего кроме одной, двух композиций я для себя не выделил. Такое чувство что играл без музыки. А вот к звукам претензий нет, это надо слышать как они на своём жучьем языке говорят – очень забавляет.
Вроде всё упомянул, надеюсь ничего не забыл.

Плюсы:
+ Визуальный стиль
+ Сюжет
+ Сеттинг
+ Геймплей
+ Диалоги/Юмор
+ Разнообразие мира/Наполненность
+ Цена

Минусы:
- Музыка
- Продолжительность

Что мы имеем в сухом остатке:
Я думаю эта игра понравится как детям так и взрослым. Детям за необычный сеттинг, побывать в роли букашки, а взрослым ещё и за отличные диалоги и юмор. Красивая картинка и разнообразие мира, заставят вас остановится и поглазеть на локации. Жаль только что подкачала музыка, в ней попросту нет запоминающихся треков. Ещё стоит отметить небольшую продолжительность, около 5-6 часов. Да, локации разнообразны и хорошо наполнены, но их не очень много, хотелось бы больше. Но если сложить всё вместе, то игра достойна внимание и цена которую за неё просят, оправдана.

Итог: 8/10 Рекомендую.
 
SHiSH
1,179 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 novembre 2021
What a strange little game. I by no means could say I didn't enjoy it - I did - but it was just so weird.

First off: the art style and aesthetic are fantastic. This game looks weirdly realistic and painterly at the same time. I consistently felt wowed by how beautiful this game looked. The levels have this wonderful presentation, where you get to explore a cluttered office space as a tiny bug, or enter a gramophone that the bugs use as a bar/club. It's really well-done.

However, as another reviewer said, the game seriously lacked variety in the kinds of bugs I got to see. It was the same exact insect model with different colours. It gets rather monotonous after a while, and it's clearly a sign of a lack of time/resources on the dev's end (which I sympathise with, them being an indie studio).

To add to this, there's parts of the game where it just feels like the explorable area is huge but without much to really do. And when your objective takes you across large parts of that map/level multiple times, it gets a bit tiring (even though you generally know where you should be going). This really hurts the pacing of the game and made me feel like even the 4.5 hrs I spent could have been cut by an hour so. I really enjoy short games that don't overstay their welcome, and Metamorphosis was stretching that line a bit too far.

The above two points lead me to believe that this game started off as a far more ambitious project than what we got (because the first half of the game is beautiful and lavishly detailed), but as they burned through time and resources, they realised they'd have to seriously scale back the scope or risk running out of money. The second half not only feels a bit soulless and dull, it's actively boring to play, which the first half was certainly not.

Finally, the story. I didn't really get the story...? It felt like there was an important story going on in the background that I was being withheld from because I've been morphed into a bug. Which I guess is part of it, but it seemed rather aimless. Yes, the protagonist's main objective was to turn back into a human, but there was really nothing else to motivate me from a narrative perspective. No interesting characters, plot points, etc. The human characters were having some kind of conflict/story that seemed to be potentially interesting, but just like the radio transmissions in MGS V, it was all happening in the background and I couldn't really pay attention half the time.

And the ending was so stupidly rushed and completely random. It had no emotional impact, no catharsis. It made no sense that they would end it like that, and it felt rather like the devs had gotten sick of their game and wanted to be done with it as soon as they could (although I'm sure that's not the case, they probably just ran out of time). Which is a real shame.

Anyway, this is certainly an odd game that not everyone will enjoy, but if you like weird and beautiful art direction, some interesting levels and presentation, maybe give it a shot. This is a very conditional 'Do Recommend' from me. Just don't set your expectations too high.
 
Aniche

Évaluation publiée le 4 décembre 2020
Я не читал Кафку.

И я не могу сказать ради чего стоит покупать данную игру за полную цену или по скидке в 50%.

Да, в ней есть высказывания упомянутого писателя.
Да, есть сюжетный твист с превращением главного героя из человека в жука.
Да, есть причудливая музыка с оперным вокалом.
Да, есть относительно забавные диалоги людей.
Да, есть красивые локации.

НО!

Cюжетно НИЧЕГО среднего или стоящего НЕТ.
Геймплей банален и примитивен: ползаешь по стенам, иногда прыгаешь или крутишь.
Персонажи - стоячие манекены, реплики только по клавише "е", в остальное время мёртвая тишина.
История немногословна: информация ни прямо, ни косвенно практически не подаётся игроку.
Также игра крайне короткая: она предлагает максимум 6 часов.

Вердикт: не берите игру, если на неё не стоит скидка 70 или 80%. В остальном это бессмысленная трата денег.

23.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mars 2021
🎵Metamorphosis OST by Garry Schyman and Mikolai Stroinski🕷️

Has it ever occurred to anyone that many of the walking simulator and side-tasks adventure games have roots in Kafka's novels by their structure?

You've got a main task. You're looking for help to complete it and come across the right people.

And you either have to do something or find what they need.

After you've got it and given away the items or the necessary information, you've got to move to the next character. And it needs something else.

In some games it takes a long, it depends.

Of course, it looks mostly not so dystopian, burocratical and hopeless as in Kafka's masterpieces.

For example, in Eastshade it‘s a real fun.

But I’m pretty sure: this gameplay idea was borrowed from Kafka.

10/10
 
Aliona

Recommandé
3.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 septembre 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

I can imagine this game isn't for everyone, but if you're familiar with Franz Kafka's work or want to experience something different for a change, then I highly recommend Metamorphosis.

You'll have to solve puzzles, by interacting with the environment, to make progress in the game. This is done in a very clever way and the puzzles are just hard enough to keep the player interested. Since you're a tiny bug, the world around you has become enourmous. Mundane objects are now hurdles to overcome and you'll have to make clever use of those objects.

Another thing I enjoyed very much was the atmosphere and feel of the game. The graphics were lovely, almost like a painting coming to life, and the sound design was absolutely top notch.

Being a big fan of Kafka's work, this was a wonderful experience.

8/10

Full review can be read here[www.female-gamers.nl] (in Dutch).

Recommandé
8.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 décembre 2020
I've become convinced, over the years, that anytime a game gets mixed reviews but you keep hearing the critics say things like "This game isn't bad, in fact it's quite good, but it will probably only appeal to a certain type of gamer," you can pretty much safely assume you're dealing with a truly excellent game, lol. Of course, a writer like Kafka created his own visionary universe so the developers had excellent source material to work with. The environments/maps and the dialogue(subtitled on account of the delightfully bizarre sounding insect voices) in this game are outstanding. The controls are tight and the innovative soundtrack fits perfectly. There are subtle nods to games like Naissance as well as classics like Portal, HL2 and Dishonored. The developers nailed everything in this game. The ending was a bit abrupt and things end on a very serious fairly depressing note but hey, it's Kafka we're talking about here. Actually, there was a lot of good humor scattered throughout the game so overall it's not really that depressing. It's a great little first person adventure game and well worth your time. It's arguably slightly overpriced based on the aspect of length. If you get this on sale you can't go wrong.

Good, but there is a glitch where if you die (I jumped on the projector tape) when you're supposed to jump into the projector then it sets you back multiple chapters. Since there's no save/loads (it just autosaves) you'll need to go to Chapter Select and redo it up to that point and try again.

Non recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 aout 2020
I played the demo during the event a while ago and loved it. But now after actually playing the full game I can't say it was worth the money. The environments are pretty and the start of the game is very intriguing, playing with perspective and relative sizes. But it soon loses steam after the great first few levels. You'll be talking to bugs and solve trivial platforming puzzles. Later you will be primarily walking from A to B and back to A again which turns the initially great experience into an absolute drag. If you need to buy it, do not buy it at full price.

Edit: For some reason, the further you advance through the levels the more grammatical and spelling errors you will encounter. If this is something that bothers you, it's going to be difficult to ignore.
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation

Recommandé
2.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 mars 2021
Short and sweet, appropriately filled with Kafka's view of the world, but don't expect much gameplay - it's a walking simulator through and through with extremely limited gameplay elements, basically consisting of walking to places, talking to NPCs, and literally a couple puzzles here and there. That being said, the story is simple but effective, what's the of puzzles is reasonable and doesn't get annoying, and the whole thing is engaging for the length of it and doesn't overstay its welcome. Plus, couple of reasonable achievements to hunt down, for whoever cares about them.

Not a masterpiece, but a nice palate cleanser between bigger titles.

Évaluation publiée le 18 avril 2021
a surrealist trip down a bug-infested rabbit-hole, metamorphosis' greatest flaw is its minuscule length. its simplistic gameplay and maps captures the limited scope and feel of a man turned into a bug, which made me think this game would be great in vr. metamorphosis' thrusts the player into a topsy-turvey, needlessly bureaucratic world, but bureaucracy is presented as such a blatant straw-man it makes me want to defend it even tho i've hated it most my life. :/ if you enjoy alice, orwell, terry gilliam's brazil, surrealism, and bugs, as i do, you'll probably really like this game... but in the time it takes other games to get going, this one ends. $25, no. <$8, maybe? \_("/)_/

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Metamorphosis - Review

En la industria hemos asumido roles poco comunes, criaturas alienígenas, animales salvajes u ominosos entes supernaturales, de modo que interpretar a un escarabajo no debería suponer nada descabellado, sin embargo, Ovid Works logra romper el molde, puesto que realmente hace sentir aquella disparatada transformación. Es decir, vivir los cambios en tiempo real y su efecto en el ambiente, una serie de detalles que permiten afinar la literatura de lo absurdo. Tal vez, no sea absolutamente fiel a la obra de Franz Kafka, puesto que los chicos de Ovid Works se han tomado ciertas libertades creativas ♥♥♥ el fin de re-inventar esta icónica obra y sorprender al público. El resultado final, no deja de ser curioso, pero ♥♥♥ un embriagante aroma de misticismo, que tan bien le sientan a los gigantescos mundos de papel ideados por el autor.

En lo que respecta a jugabildiad, Metamorphosis hace uso del plataformeo y la lógica a través de puzles ambientales para meternos en los inusuales recovecos de la habitación de Gregory. Al controlar un insecto los movimientos tienden a ser ligeramente diferentes a lo que estamos acostumbrados, puesto que ahora el tamaño se ha reducido de manera considerable. Además, le han crecido un par de extremidades extra ♥♥♥ una fuerza sobrenatural para saltar grandes alturas o adherirse como una estampilla en las superficies, aunque para esto último necesitaremos de algún que otro aderezo.

Metamorphosis no es el primer intento por llevar los oníricos mundos de papel de Franz Kafka a la industria de los videojuegos, puesto que ya existe algún que otro precedente. Precedentes regulares o más bien medidores, pero existen, para bien o para mal. Por lo tanto, no es terreno desconocido, sin embargo, esta nueva aproximación, es la más correcta ♥♥♥ una armonía sobrenatural en cada uno de sus apartados. En fin, Ovid Works inicia su carrera en la industria de los videojuegos ♥♥♥ el pie derecho, ♥♥♥ una correcta y contemplativa aventura interactiva. Quizás un juego algo corto, pero intenso, que interpreta muy bien el relato de Kafka.

Puntos Positivos

*Una aproximación bastante acertada de la obra de Kafka.
*La sensación de controlar a un insecto está bien conseguida.
*Una experiencia surrealista sin igual.
*Escalar sus escenarios tiene su encanto.
*Una dirección artística muy bien cuidada.

Puntos Negativos

*Quizás los puzles podrían evolucionar en paralelo ♥♥♥ sus escenarios y generar desafíos más exigentes.
*Duración algo ajustada.
*Inexistente soporte para resoluciones ultra-panorámicas.

Para leer el analisis completo dirigirse al siguiente enlace:

PC Indie Master Race [pcindiemrace.com]
 
MadMax
2,452 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 mai 2021
Оценка игры: 7,6/10
Это первый взгляд на игру. Не путайте с понятием "обзор". Здесь я делюсь с вами настоящими, живыми ощущениями и эмоциями от первого запуска игрового продукта и не имею опыта полного прохождения.

Иррациональные приключения жука Грегора в театре абсурда, где издевательство над логикой и здравым смыслом возведено в абсолют. И да, все это Кафка. Как много в имени этом сокрыто для знающего человека. Но я отношусь к категории людей далеких от его творчества. Поэтому по-началу мне приходилось искать логику и смысл в происходящем на экране. Именно такой расклад подтверждает мои мысли о том, что абстракция в видео играх - никогда не приводила к успешности. Ведь люди платят за развлечение себя любимых чаще, чем за бессмысленное времяпрепровождение. Спасает положение хороший визуальный ряд. Приятная графика с качественной детализацией и высокой степенью проработки локаций. Качественный дизайн уровней, хорошая производительность, удобное управление. А ещё интересно поставленные диалоги, которые происходят параллельно действиям главного героя. Кстати, такой подход к построению повествования сбивает с толку ибо не всегда мне удавалось успеть прочесть субтитры. Однако сам сюжет получился любопытным и немного интригующим.

Визуал и техническое состояние: 8
Активности и механики: 7
Карты, локации и левел-дизайн: 8
Сюжет, сценарий и сеттинг: 7
Цена и качество: 8

Подробнее об игре, её сильных и слабых сторонах можно узнать из ролика ниже.
Подписывайтесь и присоединяйтесь к моему каналу!

Vues : 57
"ПЕРВЫЙ ВЗГЛЯД" (рубрика). Разбираем и оцениваем игру Metamorphosis. Разработчиком выступает польская студия Ovid Works. За издание отвечает польская компания All in! Games.

Recommandé
12.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juillet 2022
É uma satisfação poder jogar esse game baseado numa grande obra da literatura mundial, do também genial autor Kafka. A história do jogo conseguiu mesclar muito bem as duas principais tramas escritas por esse escritor tcheco: "a metamorfose" e a obra "o processo". Como se os dois protagonistas da trama, se "encontrassem" e um deles virado inseto, pudesse ajudar o outro em seu processo judicial que já havia iniciado (de forma totalmente absurda, claro).

Muitas frases filosóficas estão por vários locais... O teor de absurdismo filosófico e surrealismo ficou muito bem empregado no enredo, de forma que extraiu legal a inspiração da obra literária para dentro de um jogo.
 
Skyzhoprenic
113 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 avril 2021
Produit remboursé

酷く酔う気配がし始めたので不本意ながら返品しました。

最初に部屋で目が覚め‥自分が虫になり‥視点が低くなり‥移動するあたりで早くもめまいがし、表題が出るころには完全に酔ったので諦めました。

The Unfinished Swanという別のゲームで酷く酔いながらもエンディングまで行ったら体調を崩したので、今回は早々にギブアップ。
絵画的な世界を見るのが好きなので、とても残念です。

返金理由に「ゲームが難しすぎます」という選択肢があったのでそれを選び、「３Dで酔うので続けられません、申し訳ございませんが云々」と記入しました。クラッシュやバグ以外でも返金を認めてくれるので驚きました（返金のルール自体は厳格らしいです）。

雰囲気ゲームが好きでアクションがある程度得意、かつ酔わない人にはおすすめできるかもしれません。

Recommandé
2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 février 2021
Inspired by Franz Kafka, this great mix between weird fiction and magical realism casts you in the role of a man turned suddenly and inexplicably into a little bug and lets you explore a civilization built by insects but resembling our own. The unsettling atmosphere of the strangely bureaucratic insect world, unusual music, solid voice-acting, and dialogues full of legal gibberish that illustrates said bureaucracy make the game unique.

Beanie
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 aout 2020
友達の家に泊まって翌朝起きたら小さな虫になっていた。引き出しの中や本棚の裏にある穴を通って虫たちの住む荒唐無稽な世界を旅することに。
リアルの虫になりきれるゲームではなく、この世界の虫たちはダンスホール作って踊っていたりと人間くさい。
フランツ・カフカの「変身」がモチーフの作品だそうだが、特にストーリーが沿っているわけではない。

映像がきれいでカオス。現実(?)世界は全てが大きく見え、虫世界はファンタジーしてる。
虫の一人称視点のため操作はクセがある。視点が低い。視界が物で埋まりがち。ジャンプして飛び移るのがすごく怖い。身軽な虫なら大丈夫だろ、という高さでも落ちたら死ぬ。チェックポイントがこまめでやり直しのストレスは少ない。
ホラーではない。敵と戦ったりはしない。ジャンプ、走りジャンプ、ボタンを押す（乗っかる）、レバーをまわす（上で走る）、などで進んでいく。
ねっとりしたもの（糊、バター、インク）などを吸うことで、有限の粘着性を得て縦移動も可能。縦移動の視点移動が慣れるまで難しい。
それほど難しいパズルはない。次は何をすべきかという小目標が出る。
翻訳は多少のぎこちなさがあるが、理解できる。しかし文書類に翻訳されていないものがあり、英語苦手だからよくわからないところが。わからないなりに進めはする。
見せ場で流れるテーマソング？がきれい。
終わり方について、ハッピーエンド！という感じではない。「変身」ほど悲惨な死亡エンドとかではないんだけど。エンドを迎えた時、「え？」となった。こういう結末の物語にしても、そこで終わるのか。マルチエンドで、2つのエンドを見たがどっちもぷつっと終わる。分岐点は、書類を3階に送るかかまどに送るか。他にもあるのかな？
 
トロロアニマル
243 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Ein Spiel nach den Werken von Franz Kafka, das ganz und gar nicht kafkaesk daher kommt. Das ist nicht negativ gemeint, denn statt dem rätselhaften Unheimlichen, hat man eine menge Spaß bei diesem Spiel.

Ist die Steuerung, besonders bei den Sprung-Passagen anfangs etwas ungewohnt (was natürlich auch an der ungewohnten Spielerperspektive liegt), merkt man schnell, dass sie auch sehr gnädig ist und eines der sechs Beine doch auf der Plattform landen lässt.

Die Umgebungen sind schön und abwechslungsreich gestaltet, was gegen Ende etwas abnimmt, was aber auch zur Erzählung passt. Literatur-Kenner entdecken Anspielungen auf Die Verwandlung, das Urteil oder der Prozess, die mit viel Respekt in die Geschichte eingebunden sind.

Eine wirklich besondere Erfahrung, die man nicht alle Tage findet.
 
Der Zinni
1,622 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 aout 2020
"Metamorphosis" ; Sözlük anlamı; Dönüşüm / Başkalaşım.

- Kapitalist bir sistemin bir uşağı olan Samsa, işini kaybetme korkusu ile yaşayan bir bireydir. Bulunduğu sistemde işten atılmak, toplum için değeri düşük bir birey olmakla eşdeğerdir...

- Kafka’nın eserde ele aldığı yabancılaşma türü bireyin kendine yabancılaşmasıdır. Kafka anne babasına karşı evlat olarak, devlet ve toplum yapılanmasına karşı birey olarak kendini eksik hissetmektedir.

- Bireyin kendini anlatma konusunda yaşadığı psikolojik gerilimlerin yabancılaşmayı besleyen bir kaynak olduğu düşünülebilir.

- Dönüşüm'ün görünümle hiç bir alakası yok, insanın kendisine Yabancılaşmasıdır.

*Bu oyunun sistemsel bir eleştiri olduğunu bilerek oynayın. //8-10//

/*Franz Kafka’nın Dönüşüm kitabını mutlaka okuyun*/

Vidéo YouTube™: Metamorphosis (Demo) 
Vues : 28
Steam Oyun Festiivali YAZ 2020 "Metamorphosis" Demosu
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation
ERCY35
680 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 avril 2021
Занятная и причудливая игрушка, с гармоничным музыкальным сопровождением и забавным жучиным юморком. Быстро проходится, сложных загадок не имеет. Персонаж Грегор Замза, превратившийся в насекомое, заимствован из короткой повести Франца Кафки "Превращение" - больше никакой связи с этим произведением здесь нет. Но оказывается есть еще роман "Процесс" и вот с ним остальная связь. Надо будет прочитать, спасибо комментариям. Вот и будете вы в виде букашки бегать со скоростью таракана и прыгать подобно блохе, пытаясь добраться до некоей Башни. В глаза бросается простота сюжета, зацикленность диалогов и движений других персонажей, иногда вместо фоновой речи вообще может повиснуть непонятная тишина - так и не поняла, баг (хехе) ли это или игровая особенность. Общее время обычного прохождения - примерно 6-7 часов. Для удобства в игре предусмотрена кнопка общего вида локации, можно увидеть где находитесь вы и ваша цель, рассмотреть пути её достижения. Есть альтернативные решения для некоторых задач. Имеется возможность пробежать игру минуя почти все побочные взаимодействия с другими жуками. Диалоги можно пропускать, не скипаются только основные катсцены. Таким образом, можно ускорить прохождение еще больше, если нужно перепройти главу или всю игру.
Дополнительно по локациям разбросаны секретики в виде пирамидок из жучиных яиц, которые нужно разрушать (для одного из достижений). Иногда запрятаны они весьма изощренно. Зубодробительных достижений не замечено.
В целом игра вызывает двоякое впечатление: она мне нравится, запоминается стилем и антуражем, но очень уж простая по структуре, после прохождения в воздухе висит немой вопрос: "и это всё?". Так что за полную стоимость (сейчас - 435 руб.) я бы все же не стала рекомендовать, лучше за половину (собственно, за столько я ее и купила). Но оценка положительная.
 
Orlyana

本作又名《昆虫行走模拟器》，基于小说《变形记》人物和设定改编。扭曲的世界，超现实的场景，荒诞的对话，固定的阶级，悲剧的核心，都向玩家们体现了资本主义社会对人的压榨，和异化。即使变成了虫子，还是逃不过资本主义的腐蚀，依然身处局中，要么被其他虫子剥削，要么就被高塔剥削。套用公知们最喜欢说的话，这都是体制的问题！

Recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

I made a longer, more in-depth video review here:
Vidéo YouTube™: Metamorphosis Is A Wild and Fascinating Game | Metamorphosis Review 
Vues : 1,421
Metamorphosis is a new game that is heavily inspired by the book with the same name by Franz Kafka. It is a super intriguing adventure set in a fascinating world.

Metamorphosis is a wild and fascinating game that is heavily inspired by the novella with the same name by Franz Kafka.

At the start of the game you find yourself turned into a tiny little bug and at first it is very Alice in Wonderland like as your character is discovering what it means to be transformed into a bug.

You can crawl on surfaces and run and jump to other platforms. Also if you touch something sticky like paint or ink you get a kind of a stamina meter that allows you to walk up surfaces and on the side of walls.

And so overall this is a decent puzzle, platformer but what makes this game truly special is the world and environments you are exploring. Every area of the game is super beautiful or super interesting to explore and you can tell a lot of effort when into the presentation of the game.

Also the story revolves around you trying to make your way at first to a mystical tower which will supposedly get you closer to finding a way to become a human again and because of this, there are whole little civilizations of other bugs that you can talk with and gain some lore into this smaller bug world.

I was not expecting the game to have a ton of dialogue and lore but it does, and some of the dialogue is genuinely emotional and sometimes freaking hilarious. The writing in this game is top notch.

I also really like how your story parallels with another story going on in the human world at the same time.

Overall if this game seems intriguing I would highly recommend you to stop reading reviews about this game and just go play it for yourself as I think a lot of the fun in this game is discovering and learning about this super fascinating world.

For more videos and reviews follow my curator page!

TimeToGrind

Évaluation publiée le 12 aout 2020

Полное прохождение:
Vidéo YouTube™: Metamorphosis -1- ПРЕВРАТИЛСЯ В ЖУКА! ЖЕСТЬ! [Прохождение на русском] 
Vues : 4,063
📌 Плейлист Metamorphosis: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLyd3jy1EFI7IOsp8bsLcchQUGY-f-LV_I 👻 Страшные Истории на Ночь с Зоди: https://youtube.com/HorrorZodi 💘 Паблик ВК:...


Metamorphosis - замечательное исследовательское приключение. Мы играем за Грегора - человека, который превратился в жука. Он отправляется в путешествие, чтобы найти место под названием "Башня" - это единственная возможность вернуть себе человеческий облик. Кроме того, надо ведь и другу помочь, у которого вдруг появились проблемы с полицией, и это тоже как-то связано с нашим превращением... Сюжет игры очень интересен. Геймплей представляет из себя исследование локаций, выполнение несложных задач и поиск пути дальше. Локации разнообразные и просто шикарные! Учитывая, что мы играем жуком, мы можем залезть почти куда угодно. Также есть элементы платформинга. Управление очень удобное. Выглядит и звучит игра тоже отлично. Очень рекомендую, я от этой игры в восторге!
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation
PlayZodi
1,878 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 aout 2020
本作剧情上与卡夫卡的《变形记》并无多大关联，故就算没读过原著，游玩起来并无多大障碍，只是内含许多原著中的元素，如此才能更好地体会到其中的韵味，所以有能力的话还是建议读完原著。（据说与卡夫卡的《审判》也有关联，但恕我才疏学浅，并未读过，在此并不做过多的评论）

应该是双结局，但目前我只通了一个结局

没有人是小甲虫，或者，人人都是小甲虫

主角格里高尔在某天早上醒来后，发现自己变成了一只小甲虫（原著中格里高尔变的是体型与人一样大的甲虫，在此是与普通的虫子在体型上无异的甲虫），为恢复人类之身，须前往高塔的故事，期间同时并行着好友约瑟夫被戴上莫须有的罪名，以及其寻找律师，寻求法律帮助的荒诞故事，以一个小甲虫的视角，描绘了两个个普通守法公民在一个荒诞的世界发生的两件相互交织，相辅相成的事。
故事荒诞有趣，音乐极度契合时代，有种令人在看上个世界二三十年代有声电影的感觉，同时在一些细节上的处理也非常到位（好歹是解谜游戏），如在开头的走廊上的画，桌上的零零散散的文件，虫子世界中与每只虫子的对话，都很好地丰富了对这个荒诞世界的描绘，人即是虫，虫也不过是人罢了，既然如此，身处这样的世界，是否是人身又有何重要呢？所有的这些不过是一遍又一遍的轮回，这个世界每一天的日常。恰到好处的戛然而止的结局（我所完成的），仿佛就像是在和你说，该说的我已经全部告诉你了，剩下的亦都是你所经历过的了，给我较深印象的是在结尾处那音乐，像是把玩家所经历的过程提炼升华了一般，突然将世界缩小了一样，用巨人的眼界看待世界，在此难以用语言表达我的感受，还请诸位感兴趣的玩家在游戏中体会。

Évaluation publiée le 10 aout 2021
A walking simulator, with some fairly light puzzles, but satisfying enough. Absolutely stunning, one of a kind game. I've played some strange games, but none took me on a journey quite like this. Soundtrack was excellent, art style was a surreal gallery of paintings come to life. If you are a fan of Franz Kafka, or like a good, weird tale, you will probably like this game. It is fairly short, but I'm super glad I picked it up.

Évaluation publiée le 20 septembre 2020
奇妙なゲーム。
身に覚えのない罪で有罪となった友人と、どういう理由か突然虫になった主人公。
主人公は友人を助けつつ人間に戻るため奮闘する…というゲーム。

しかし…なんだろうか、なんかつまらない。
身に覚えがある人もいるだろう、2000年代のどうにも洗練されておらず、
プレイ中にずっとなにか違和感や退屈さを感じる海外製ゲームそのまま。

ゲームのボリュームは 4時間あればクリアできる
ストーリーも スタートは面白いのに、納得のいく説明がされず、なにがなんだかわからないまま延々流されて、尻切れトンボで終わってしまう。謎もほとんど明かされない。

セールで買って500円程度だったら楽しめるかも？とかそんな作品。
 
Tomu
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 septembre 2023
Aggressively indie, and with a game length of about 2 hours - more if you do the achievements - I have nothing bad to say about Metamorphosis. It is a small game, with a few added twists and turns here and there, and it is sufficiently short to not outstay its welcome without introducing any new mechanic or a deeper, more intricate story.

At the end of the day, it's just a quaint platformer-adventure, it's not here to challenge you and give you some teeth-clenching levels, it's here to give you some sightseeing and a breakfast story, though I'd like to see a more fleshed out game in a similar thematic.

My only complaint is related to certain electric achievement, which is impossible to get due to an unintended bug.
 
Ice
601 produits enregistrés

8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 aout 2020
I am an hour in the game and I guess that's enough for a first little "review".

This game is a first person adventure/puzzle game like among the sleep and others.
You play a little bug that tries to reach "the tower".
I will not say more about the story because of spoilers.

The game runs smooth without any bugs. The grafic is good (not mindblowing but fitting) and the controls with a gamepad are intuitive. The Voiceover is good.
The puzzles are not that hard and it's more like a "where should I go next".
The game has a lot of Kafka references (not only gregor samsas metamorphosis) but it's not the story told as a game...
Overall this game is a cool adventure and the walking around like a bug is a fresh thing.

Atm. I'm not sure how long this game will be but I can't imagine it will be longer than 5 hours (will edit it when finished).

Machines Are Human
808 produits enregistrés
1
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
30.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 mai 2021
SINTESI DEL GAMEPLAY

In sostanza il gioco è incentrato sull'esplorazione e il platforming 3D. In pratica la difficoltà sta nel raggiungere gli obiettivi (saltando e scalando) e nel risolvere puzzle estremamente semplici.

ESTRO ARTISTICO

Il gioco ha una direzione artistica superlativa. L'estetica e la narrazione sono curatissimi. M. è ovviamente ispirato al romanzo di Kafka "La metamorfosi" ma assume toni ancora più lisergici, più vicini alle opere di Carrol per capirci. La narrazione lascia intuire che tutto sia una grande metafora umana, come anche una grande satira sociale. Se la sfida degli sviluppatori era quella di farci provare la suggestione di essere piccoli come un insetto, il gioco ci riesce perfettamente, come riesce a trasmettere, spesso anche ♥♥♥ una certa ironia, il dramma esistenziale del nostro personaggio.

PRO

Direzione artistica al top. Grande narrazione. Grandi suggestioni visive ed emotive.

CONTRO

Chi cerca più gameplay che narrazione, più gameplay che esperienzialità, e chi non sa che farsene del platforming 3D, troverà il gioco ripetitivo.

10/10

After playing a little more, I tried dropping an apple playing along the story line, I jumped on it, It fell, and rolled over me and killed me and sent me back an hour or so behind where i was, instead of right before I jumped on the apple for the guy that was going to help me, THIS HAPPENED TO ME TWICE. (Developers have claimed to fix this bug in the latest patch as of editing this review)

Metamorphosis is a really good game where you play as a bug! (which was the first time for me ;) to complete puzzles and challengers with you bug powers to progress though the game and try to work out what is happening to you and restore yourself back to your human form.
It reminds me a lot of a kind of Alice in wonderland vibe but this time you see and do everything’s from a bugs point of view in a strange giant world around you. It’s no too hard as you can ask the game for help if you need it, and the puzzles are fun to do. Yes I liked the game and I do recommend playing it.

Shadow Onyx
572 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 aout 2020
Metamorphosis is a first-person-platforming adventure developed by the young polish studio Ovid Works.

The game is partially based on Franz Kafka's story of the same name, Metamorphosis, in which Gregor Samsa wakes up as a bug one morning after anxious dreams, however while Gregor, the player character, does indeed transform into a bug, much of the story is actually based on another story by Kafka called The Trial. This was to be expected as the storyline of Metamorphosis would hardly make for a good game, and The Trial is a good choice for a conflict and as Kafka's second most popular story.

Essentially, you are turned into a bug and overhear your friend Josef K. get arrested before you could draw anyone's attention to you to help you. You are now on your quest to become human again and to help your friend Josef with his trial. This duality of the story becomes interesting and important later on, however since the game is so short I don't want to give anything away.

The game itself is a first-person-platformer, and I know what that sounds like. It sounds ♥♥♥♥. But to my surprise, it largely isn't. The movement feels fun, the game is very lenient with letting you get away with jumps and even when you fail the time it takes to respawn is surprisingly short, almost instant even. The game also manages to make crawling around quite intuitive, even if some structures of clutter seem a bit ouf of place. The only problems with it are that some walls you can't climb aren't indicated properly and sometimes when crawling the camera gets a bit confusing, but that's no big deal. Levels vary, look gorgeous and don't overstay their welcome. If you ever get lost, pressing Tab gives you an overview of the level and marks points of interest. The atmosphere is great, a lot of the books and documents are (accurately to Kafka) in german as the game takes place in Vienna and the smooth orchestral soundtrack is outstanding for this type of game and also features german vocals whenever it uses vocals. The artsy 1920s style just scratches an itch for me, I guess.

The game has some shortcomings though. For one, it is literally short. 20,99€ for a 4-hour-game is a hefty price, at least for me, but then again I also didn't mind that with other games from the narrative first-person adventure genre like Gone Home or Firewatch. Just be wary wether or not that's the type of game you want to pay this much for.

But there's also shortcomings in the technical department: Voice clips that play twice in a row when they shouldn't, at times janky platforming, spelling mistakes in the german translations and kind of uncanny animations and models for humans (though that may just be to make them more grotesque). And for me at least, the game also had issues with performance, though I will have to check this once I have a more up to date PC.

You could also argue that the story only really resembles Kafka's writing on the surface level, since it's hard to express and at the same time gamify the frustration of bureacracy and hardships of life that Kafka dealt with (except that this has been done before successfully with Papers, Please).

But at the end of the day, while it wasn't as grandiose, deep and artistic as I wanted it to be, it was a fun evening and a bold and interesting idea for a game, and I'll be looking out for what comes next from Ovid Works.

7/10 - Nice way to spend an afternoon.
 
AL1

Non recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 aout 2020
When I played the demo of this game, I was interested in it. And I'll be honest I was still interested in it for a couple of beginning levels.
However after a while I realised that the game had a pretty uninteresting story and gameplay. The game looks pretty and it's more akin to a walking simulator with only light puzzle and platforming elements (even if the game is based on platforming).

Sadly the story of this walking sim is pretty uninteresting and the puzzle / platforming elements never add anything new (the only puzzle elements are rollers that you use to move things and the sticky liquid that lets you climb walls) which would be fine if the puzzles at least got a little more difficult but they are always the same (find the roller and use it, maybe sometimes climb a wall or jump on something so the roller works)

The game in my opinion doesn't deserve that high of a price. If you ever want to get it, just get it on a deep discount or don't bother.
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation
TheWojtek11
216 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 février 2023
Metamorphosis is a creative and interesting narrative-based first-person exploration/puzzle game. You play as a human who is transformed into a bug and must learn about bureaucracy in the bug world that runs parallel to that of the human world in order to help a friend out of a legal dilemma. It plays in the first person perspective, with ample opportunities for platforming and navigating large areas, and several puzzles that can be pretty clever. The game is presented through an absurdist lens where the more you learn the less things make sense.

I enjoyed how different Metamorphosis felt from many games. It felt so satisfying to explore an oversized world as a bug that I'm kind of surprised we don't see more games do that. The game's pretty straightforward and progress is made at a fairly brisk pace, although it seemed to me that some of the dilemmas I was presented with could be solved a few ways, which was interesting. I don't think I'll be coming back to it any time soon, but I found this game to be worth playing.
 
Tanoomba

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

6.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 aout 2020
Metamorphosis is one giant mindboggling adventure.. It'll endlessly leave you confused and wanting more in a good way. My first playthrough took around 4 hours as the environments for each zone can easily have you lost in exploration. The game itself seems to have various different story lines depending on the decisions you make; as well as a bunch of side quests and hidden secrets to find along the way. To get the most out of your adventure; search each area immensely as it's easy to skip parts of the game. I would 100% recommend playing this and intend on doing my second playthrough over the weekend.

Lo recomiendo en una buena oferta, ya que teniendo en cuenta el precio en otros paises que es de 20 dolares, puede ser alto para lo poco que ofrece.
 
EVANGELOS
929 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Review para o portal Newsinside.org. ( https://www.newsinside.org/review-metamorphosis/ )
Key cedida pelos Desenvolvedores

Metamorphosis, um jogo indie desenvolvido pela Ovid Works e lançado pela All in! games, conta a história de uma pequena e misteriosa aventura de Gregor Samsa, que foi transformado em inseto para tentar recuperar seu corpo e ajudar seu melhor amigo Joseph, que foi acusado de cometer um crime.

O jogo apresenta um mundo misterioso e corrupto de uma perspectiva completamente diferente de qualquer outro jogo de detetive.

Gregor acorda de uma ressaca e se vê trancado em um quarto relativamente familiar, mas logo ao notar que está “preso” em um corpo de inseto, a forma como o jogo é conduzido é completamente alterada. Metamorphosis tem uma jogabilidade fluída e simples. Não há nenhum tipo de confronto. O design de níveis e os quebra-cabeças são os únicos obstáculos para o progresso do jogo. Esses problemas podem ser facilmente resolvidos com um pouco de paciência e atenção.

O mundo de Metamorphosis é basicamente dividido em mundo humano e mundo dos insetos.

O primeiro mundo, o dos humanos, tem um level design fantástico: cada livro, obstáculos quase intransponíveis, pequenos objetos, e muitas outras coisas tem seu papel no jogo. A disposição de cada objeto é como em uma casa de qualquer família, o que torna a busca por um caminho não tão óbvia no início.

Já o segundo mundo, o dos insetos, se torna uma experiência ainda mais incrível com direito a passagens escuras e nojentas, cidades inteiras de insetos, e algumas partes que chegam a ser quase alucinógenas!

Em termos de jogabilidade, o jogo segurará sua mão conforme necessário e dirá onde você deve ir através de um sistema de mapas muito interessante; um equilíbrio entre muitas informações mas sem ser um "detonado" estragando as melhores partes do jogo. Os controles são rápidos, precisos e responsivos (embora eu tive que desativar a função de suavização da câmera, que resulta em um pequeno delay do mouse). Exceto pela confusão mental durante a navegação, e ao andar pelas paredes do jogo (onde se perde a noção de cima ou baixo), no geral não encontrei problemas com o jogo. As travessias por todo o ambiente são tão deliciosas que você chega a sentir falta de um sistema de combate para dar vontade de ficar mais tempo nessas áreas. A pior parte do jogo é fetchquest: você fala com um personagem, e o personagem ♥♥♥♥ que você resolva um problema que outro personagem possa resolver, mas ele ♥♥♥♥ que você obtenha outras coisas de outro personagem, e assim por diante. Apesar de toda essa burocracia, embora seja algo chato, ainda se encaixa na temática do jogo.

O jogo é influenciado por Franz Kafka, principalmente no conto “A Metamorfose”, onde o protagonista de mesmo nome também se transformou num inseto, alegando que o personagem é inútil, insignificante e desprezível para sua família. Por outro lado, esse jogo é claramente uma alegoria da burocracia em nosso mundo, e até parece ser feito por brasileiros, pois costumamos tratar as pessoas pertencentes ao sistema como insetos sujos. Mesmo assim, a grande maioria das pessoas ainda sonha em manter a estabilidade por meio de competições (como concursos por exemplo), e o jogo reflete bem esse auge da corrupção e da burocracia, que nos faz sentir insignificantes, principalmente para pessoas como Joseph que estão presas nas “algemas” da burocracia sem entender o verdadeiro significado do que está de fato acontecendo.

TLDR: Metamophosis é uma aventura pequena e inspiradora com um mundo lindo para explorar, mas sem muitos objetivos. Sem lutas ou confrontos, o mundo acabará por passar rapidamente, pois explorar é o único objetivo na maioria das áreas. Mas o jogo conhece seu propósito e para que veio, é acima de tudo uma aventura narrativa com quebra-cabeças e uma plataforma competente, e seu tamanho não excede o que deve. Eu concluí o jogo zerando em aproximadamente 4 horas, mas foram 4 horas bem proveitosas. De acordo com as conquistas do Steam, completei apenas 69%, então, em minha opinião, ainda há muito o que fazer. Eu definitivamente irei explorar este mundo novamente.

Évaluation publiée le 13 aout 2020
One of those special surreal adventure games, like Alice Madness Returns, Little Nightmares, RiME, and Infernium.
Sadly though, it takes 3 hours to finish it, without stressing. Personally 20 euros was a bit too much for me for such a short duration. But if you got more money than me, go for it!

So a short summary:
Pros:
+ Feels nice to move, climb and jump
+ Brilliant atmosphere and design
+ Good story
+ Graphics

♥♥♥♥:
- Really damn short
- Larger areas have some FPS drops
- Very linear, so no reply value except for finding stuff you might've missed first time.

0
Recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 aout 2020
In Metamorphosis you play as Gregor. At the start of the game he discovers that he start to become a bug. His shape changes, his voice goes away (which has a cool sound).

The atmosphere of the game, the music are really great. Solve puzzles, try to find your way as a bug to other places. Which is not that simple because you are a little bug :).
A fun fact is that you can climb walls with some sticky substance.

I thought the game would be higher in price, but the price is really good for what you get.

Here you can see my transformation to a bug:
Vidéo YouTube™: Metamorphosis Gameplay / The beginning 
Vues : 46
More info about this game could be found on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1025410/Metamorphosis/ Play as Gregor, turned into a tiny bug, and set out on an extraordinary journey to unravel...

Évaluation publiée le 28 mai 2021
As a fan of Kafka's works earlier in my youth, this lived up to my expectations of a fun game inspired by his works. Highly atmospheric, possessing interesting characters, and full of references to Kafka, this game was a short yet enjoyable journey. The music in this game was rather incredible and fit the theme/period well. I did not expect this level of quality from a game with a smaller budget. Highly recommend obtaining a copy on sale and playing it through, especially for existentialist types.

Évaluation publiée le 13 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Un vídeo vale más que mil palabras............................

Vidéo YouTube™: Metamorphosis#1 EL INSECTO I Gameplay Español I Mariatxi 
Vues : 372
✌✌✌SUSCRIBETE!!!! Dale Like, comenta y ........🤞🤞🤞🤞 Sigueme como Mentor de Steam https://store.steampowered.com/curators/topcurators/?keywords=Mariatxi Si quierees apoyar el canal puedes hacerlo...


Metamorphosis nos pone en el exoesqueleto de un insecto.
Nos despertamos una mañana y somos conscientes que somos un insecto, y debemos descubrir que nos ha pasado y como volver a nuestra forma humana. A partir de aquí comienza este juego en primera persona, ♥♥♥ unos gráficos muy cuidados y una jugabilidad simple pero muy original.
Desde nuestra perspectiva de insecto debemos ir avanzando en la historia, resolviendo pequeñas situaciones para llegar a lo alto del armario, introducirnos dentro del escritorio etc.
Una grata sorpresa este metamorphosis al cual le vamos a seguir dando seguro.
Un saludo
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation
Mariatxi
1,957 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juin 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

Metamorphosis to inspirowana opowiadaniami Franza
Kafki gra mieszająca ze sobą gatunki przygodówki
i platformówki. Wcielamy się w mężczyznę o imieniu
Gregor, który po mocno zakrapianej nocy spędzonej
u przyjaciela, budzi się przemieniony w karalucha.
Przerażony szuka pomocy u swojego gospodarza Josepha,
jednak ten feralnego poranka zostaje aresztowany
i trafia przed sąd. Gregor chce pomóc uniewinnić
przyjaciela, lecz najpierw musi stać się
z powrotem człowiekiem. Możliwość taką oferuje
mu dotarcie do tajemniczej Wieży będącej centrum
biurokracji owadziego świata.
Najjaśniejszą stroną fet jest projekt poziomów.
Podziwianie świata z perspektywy małego owada
to prawdziwa uczta dla oczu. Silnik graficzny
może i nie jest najlepszej jakości, ale to,
co grafikom udało się w nim stworzyć,
robi wrażenie. Spotykane przez Gregora przedmioty
codziennego użytku wykonane są z niezwykłą dbałością
o szczegóły, a "layout" poziomów jest pomysłowy.
Stylistyka gry przypomina trochę wczesne produkcje
Tima Burtona. Trafiają się nawet etapy surrealistyczne.
Mamy na przykład poziom, w którym jesteśmy wciągnięci
w leżący na biurku list i musimy przeskakiwać
z litery na literę, unikając fruwających kawałków
grafitu. Sama rozgrywka jest dosyć prosta.
Poruszając się owadem, musimy dotrzeć do jakiegoś
określonego punku. Cała zabawa sprowadza się
do wymyślenia, jak tego dokonać. Na ogół polega
to na eksploracji dostępnego obszaru i umiejętnym
skakaniu po kolejnych platformach.
Oprawa dźwiękowa także stoi na dobrym poziomie.
Niezmiernie ciekawy jest pomysł stworzenia języka
owadów. Metamorphosis to bardzo krótka, aczkolwiek
niezwykle oryginalna gra. Grafika jest świetna,
klimat surrealityczny, a zwiedzanie świata
z perspektywy owada to naprawdę fajna zabawa.
Tytuł w udany sposób łączy ze sobą elementy
platformówki i przygodówki, a sterowanie jest
nadzwyczaj responsywne. Jedyne do czego można się
przyczepić to dwa zakończenia, które są niemiłosiernie
słabe, bardzo krótkie i rozczarowujące. Wygląda to
trochę tak, jakby twórcy sami nie wiedzieli jak
zakończyć naszą przygodę.

Ocena: 7/10
 
Amareth

Niveau scénar, on a ici une sorte de mélange entre la métarmorphose, le procès et le château avec un univers et une progression qui par contre est propre aux développeurs et qui est tout à fait génial !

Je dit oui !
 
supermonsieur
705 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
14.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 janvier 2023
A very cool walking simulator with a cool twist/idea and weird (in a good way) narrative, but overly linear and lacking any sort of deeper gameplay (like puzzles). Still, one of the better experiences in the genre entries and a must play for any walking sim fans. Flaws to be overlooked.

I have not read Metamorphosis and I know nothing about it, which is probably why I enjoyed it more than someone who would compare this with the source material. I guess going in blind was pretty great.

I didn't expect the game to be very deep from first impressions, nor have much content. I figured that it would dump the weird stuff and that's that - some vague ambiguous message. But it really committed to itself and remains true to its own logic. And it just keeps going and going and more lore and narrative and weird stuff gets added just at the right pace where you almost give up but then it gives you some more. It's just what a good walking sim should be like. I love the scale of it and the world-building. And the protagonist fully embraces it even if he remains outside the influence of it all - it's hard to explain, but it's a great progression together with the narrative. And it all resolves itself nicely more or less instead of some vague message.

Still, I would have loved some puzzles or something. Even some more platforming. Some side quests or objective tracking or at least collectibles that you can actually track. Something to keep me more invested even if it's "cheap" from designer's perspective. As a walking sim fan, it's not too difficult to engage me in an environment with literally nothing to do, but it would still be that extra push.

ЙаРыба
349 produits enregistrés

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 aout 2020
In general its a puzzle game in a weird world of bug society and mystery. I find it quite enjoyable, controls/movement are fluid - which is your main mechanic in this game, the atmosphere is sometimes more sometimes less interesting. There are minor issues with animations every now and then but they are ignoreable. I think a lot of people will find this game enjoyable, I enjoyed it more than I thought I would and for a cheap price.

I think the story might be a bit boring for people unfamiliar with Franz Kafka's works (and maybe exploration could be encouraged a bit more) but other than that I would definitely say its a game with a unique atmosphere which is hard to come by these days.

===[]===
☐ Sim, lootbox e afins quem tem 💰 vence

☐ Só se quiser pular estágios ou grind (Pague pra pular) ⏱️

☑ Nenhum
☑ Só se voce ligar para rank/placar
☑ Não é necessário para progredir
☐ Algum grind
☐ Grind médio
☐ Muito Grind
☐ Insano

☐ Tente não viciar - nivel crack ou heroína
☐ Muito boa
☑ Boa
☐ Nada Especial
☐ Marromenos
☐ Ruim
☐ Desencana, pule pro proximo
☐ Que jogabilidade? melhor olhar pro teto

☐ Só se te interessar muito

☐ Minimo
☑ Medio
☑ High end (menos de 4 anos)
☐ PC da NASA

☐ EZ PEASY LEMON SQUEAZY GG AXEI FAZIL
☑ Console (Casual)
☑ Exige pensar sobre o que esta fazendo
☐ Facil de pegar o básico/ Dificil de virar mestre (Xadrez)
☐ Dificil mecanicamente (bate e rolalike)
☐ Dificil intelectualmente (Dwarf Fortress+)

===[Ajuda aos iniciantes? 📖]===
☐ Faça esse curso e assista essa série de videos primeiro! (CK2)
☐ Não, se vira!
☑ Sim - Tutorial decente

===[Duração do jogo/conteúdo ⏳]===
☐ Bem curto ( 0 - 2 horas)
☑ Curto ( 2 - 10 horas)
☐ Algumas horas ( 8 - 20 horas)
☐ Longo ( 30+ horas)
☐ Sem fim (Depende do Jogador)

===[] ===
☐ História? Q?
☐ Cliches e chatices, mas ainda melhor que filminho
☑ Ok
☑ Boa
☐ Incrível

===[]===
☐ "Acesso antecipado, Sobrevivencia, PVP, Construção"
☐ Bugs horrorosos
☑ Alguns bugs
☑ Bugado mas engraçado
☐ Nada, roda perfeito

===[]===
☐ "QTE + Cinematics + Scripts = Cinematic Experience"
☐ "MOBA + Battle Royale + Card Game"
☑ Baseado no jogo X, mas com Y diferenças
☐ Inovador
☐ Não existem categorias para descrever - Cria um novo estilo de jogo

===[]===
☑ Quase Zero / Elder Scrolls Online/Warframe
☐ Alguma toxicidade / Maioria dos jogos online (Street Fighter,Dark Souls, WoW, etc)
☐ Toxicidade média / CS:Go - COD - BF -PUBG e outros FPS
☐ Toxicidade alta / League of Legends/ Overwatch / Dota
☐ Não existem categorias para descrever - nivel maximo de toxicidade

===[Servidores 🥔]===
☑ Sem problemas (ou é singleplayer)
☐ Algum lag/problemas de conexão
☐ Acontecem problemas de conexão pelo menos 1x por sessão
☐ Ping e latencia são um problema
☐ Desconexões e problemas são comuns
☐ Impossivel jogar online

===[Status/Saúde do jogo 🤒]===
☐ Sempre vários jogadores
☐ Sempre tem jogadores
☐ Um pouco dificil de encontrar pessoas para jogar
☐ Tente achar um grupo ou comunidade que ainda joga
☐ Quase nenhuma alma viva
☐ Morto/RIP em peperoni
☑ Single Player

HebrewDrew
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 avril 2021
If I had to summarize this game in one word: torture. Maybe it was the point.

This game is mostly a platformer. What passes as puzzle is pretty straightforward, as for the adventure: I don't see it.
There is a story, but after a few minutes all I wanted to do was mute the background voices as what they said or repeated was slowly eroding my nerves. After three hours I didn't care about the main character, nor his friend and their world.
The music is very forgettable (literally: I couldn't remember it and I heard it a few minutes ago) except for a few dissonant parts that I'll gladly never listen to ever again.
There are also a few bugs: collisions mostly, and one freeze.

There are two problems though, that made me stop definitively.
First, the controls aren't very precise, which is a bummer for a platformer.
Second, the view is pretty close to the ground, which can trigger motion sickness and has the added downside of obfuscating holes in the ground. I've felt through an unexpected hole too many times to count.
At the point I'm stopping, I'm supposed to go down a mechanical arm.
The first time I've felt through a hole I didn't see in a joint.
The second time my character slipped after a small top, and felt.
The third time I've somehow felt from the pipe I've landed on.
There was no fourth time.

I understand the idea that spawned Metamorphosis, but a game needs to be interesting or somewhat enjoyable.
I'm not interested nor invested enough to want to inflict this upon myself anymore.
I am not a masochist.
 
Hurricane
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.2 h en tout

Игра получилась довольно необычной и увлекательной, а окружающий мир по-настоящему особенным. Каждая область игры очень красива и интересна для изучения

Non recommandé

Évaluation publiée le 20 décembre 2023
the sticky stuff before the ulysses book did not work for me. I looked around for an alternate path and then looked up a walkthru video to see what I should be doing, and sure enough, that sticky stuff behind the drawer was not being triggered so I was not able to crawl up the one wall (managed to jump-jump-jump up it) but was not able to walk along the pipe side in the next part. The sticky stuff the bug uses to climb walls needs to be set to reset every time the bug steps on it so that if something happens, the bug can try again. I will wait for the next update and try the game again, and then edit this review once it is fixed. For now, the game is not working completely but has potential.

the bug stepping on the sticky stuff after crossing over the apple makes the drops appear on the screen, but not the ability to walk up or along the sides of things, so it could be that area has the issue and the walls/pipe flat area had the ability to be walked on deleted in the code. some part of the code was deleted or altered, probably in an update that was rushed out to the public before being THOROUGHLY TESTED AND LOOKED OVER.

the game is interesting, just not playable in its current condition. I will have to watch YouTube walkthrough videos now to see the rest of the game and watch someone else play it since the programmers broke the game.

no response? ok, refunded.
 
mycarispossessed
851 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mai 2021
I played through this game once, now I am on my second playthrough, so I guess I should review it now.

Pros:
- Graphics are okay and fit the type of game this is.
- The voice acting is pretty good, although most of the game you will hear the noises the bugs make, which is interesting as well.
- Although the game is mostly linear, there are some choices you can make on how to solve some of the problems you face.
- I liked the mobility of the bug. I enjoyed climbing all over the place.
- The feeling of being tiny in a world of giants is interesting.
- Some of the bugs have pretty memorable personalities.
- Two endings depending on the choice you make at the end.

♥♥♥♥:
- Human animations and expressions were mediocre. The emphasis was clearly on the bugs and their world.
- Bugs. No, I dont mean the NPCs... Basically I crashed once at both playthroughs at the exact same place, so I am convinced it is a glitch. The voice of the protagonist also gets muted randomly, so you cannot hear the noise he makes in his reply to NPCs, which kind of takes away from the immersion a bit if it happens. I also had bug NPCs get misplaced and teleported around. Luckily... nothing gamebreaking.
- The game is quite short, not worth the full price at the time of this review. Definitely get it on a sale.
- Both endings are brief and rushed. They will give you little satisfaction for finishing them.

All in all, I recommend getting it if you are interested in these type of games. But get it on a sale.
 
Bassilth
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
5.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2023
Looking back on it from a year or so out, I really enjoyed this game. I even really enjoyed it at the time, most of the time. It had its moments of frustration, when I just couldn't quite figure out what the game wanted me to do (yes, it's one of those), but fortunately, I was usually able to bail myself out, and walkthroughs were available for the couple of times I needed them.

The best part of the game is the whole idea of it, which includes the bug's eye view environment and the pseudo-claymation art style. Playing as a bug is cool, and watching the enormous humans going about their business completely oblivious to your presence literally right under their noses is a truly interesting experience. I really would like to see more of this, with less platforming and more of an investigative/story focus, but even if it followed the same path I would likely buy a sequel.

You should buy this game if you think you might like it, because you probably will.
 
Pastor of Muppets

A pity because many ideas and the music are cool.

I recommend it, but bear in mind this kind of bugs (suddenly losing progress) have been reported in various versions and they do not seem to get a fix of sort.

Recommandé
7.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 décembre 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Um jogo relativamente curto mas repleto de história e aventuras, sem contar a arte que foi maravilhosamente bem feita. Viva a vida de Gregor Samsa, um simples Caixeiro Viajante que num belo dia (ou não), acordou transformado em um inseto repugnante. Ajude Samsa a descobrir os mistérios por trás da sua transformação, além de ajudá-lo a salvar seu grande amigo, Joseph K., de um terrível destino.
Metamorphosis foi baseado em 3 contos de Franz Kafka e sem dúvida vale a pena ser jogado!
Eu super recomento! ♥

Very short, but very enjoyable at every moment. The puzzles aren't too hard and if you take a wrong step, you just get swept back up again. Great story and amazing visuals. It's a pity it's not a bit longer. Maybe a second chapter will be released and we can delve back into the tiny world again.
 
Cola
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 octobre 2020
Yes, yes, a million times yes! It's like these oldschool wholesome non-violent adventure games where you get to roam levels and do some jumping puzzles to progress with the story, but with a modern twist to it. A real proof that video games are a modern form of art.

What I mostly love about it, aside the STUNNING surrealistic scenes and the awesome feeling of being a tiny creature in a gigantic world, is the freedom of movement. If you think enough outside the box, you can reach places that seem like you shouldn't, and some places have a secret waiting for you to find ;)
Trust me, you can't break maps in this game. All the levels are polished and every corner is accounted for.

The game is short, finished it in 4 hours, and it does have some bugs (pun intended) but it definitely left me wanting more and I'm glad I bought it. If there's a sequel or some kind of DLC with more of the same formula in the making, count me in!
 
✡MechaCheff
389 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Metamorphosis may be fairly simplistic, as well as woefully short, but it’s got a ton of heart. In the end, I found that being a bug in this weird, dream-like world is actually quite fun, and although the game doesn’t do much in terms of interactivity, its charming atmosphere, sense of humor and semi-surrealistic presentation do a decent job of carrying the experience. Go into it with the appropriate expectations and you might come away pleasantly surprised.

For more indie game reviews, check out our Curator page: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/6481290-GTOGG/

Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation
DimerDS
401 produits enregistrés
1
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 aout 2020
Metamorphosis se baseia no romance Franz Kafka A Metamorfose. Nesse jogo o jogador controla um ser humano transformado em um inseto e tem que trilhar uma jornada a fim de recuperar sua forma humana. O jogo apresenta uma estética muito bonita, com diversos toques surreais. O gameplay agrada e é divertido, assumiu a forma de um inseto é prazeroso e muito interessante observar o mundo na visão de um ser desse tamanho. Entretanto o jogo apresenta curta duração, demorei cerca de 3 horas para termina-lo. O jogo peca em seu desfecho final que acontece de forma abrupta, deixando aquele sentimento de ''Foi isso?''. Uma pena, pois quando o jogo parecia que ia começar de verdade, ele acaba. Metamophosis é um jogo divertido, e bem legal se vc possuir amigos que gostam de assistir o gameplay com você. O valor full do jogo, entretanto, não vale a pena, pois o valor é elevado pelas horas de duração oferecidas..

Ein kafkaeskes, kleines Story-Spiel für zwischendurch. Die Geschichte ist hübsch ausgestaltet und kreativ. Die Steuerung ist gut und einfach. Der Soundtrack ist nichts besonderes. Wenn es eine mittlere Wertung gäbe, wäre es darauf hinausgelaufen. Für 5-6 € kann man es mal spielen.

374 produits enregistrés

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 septembre 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Tıpkı oyunun ilham aldığı kitap Dönüşüm gibi gibi oyunda da uyanınca böcek olduğumuzu fark ediyoruz. Oyundaki hikâye kitaptan biraz farklı olsa da ana karakterin ismi ve mesleği aynı, iki eserin de anlatmak istediği şey benzer. Yani beklentiniz Dönüşüm'ü oyun olarak oynamaksa Metamorphosis isteğinizi tam anlamıyla karşılamıyor, fakat sizi yine de kısa süreli, soyut, sürükleyici ve satirik bir maceranın içine atıyor. 3-4 saatlik bu deneyimi mümkün olduğunca çabuk, hikayeden kopmadan bitmenizi tavsiye ederim.

Güzel bir deneyim yaşatsa da bu kadar kısa bir oyun süresiyle 40 TL'ye değecek bir oyun olduğunu zannetmiyorum. Para derdiniz yoksa veya oyunu indirimde bulabilirseniz almanızı öneririm. İncelemenin tamamına buradan [www.savebutonu.com] ulaşabilirsiniz.

losingmymindinlockdown

Recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2023
Fairly short game inspired by the works of Franz Kafka.
The puzzles and platforming are very basic and it is closer to a walking simulator, but if you like experiences where your viewpoint is shrunk down to bug size and placed in environments of normal human scale and exploring that, you will like this game.

If you are still Unsure, try the free DEMO, it gives you just enough of a taste of everything.
 
Jax
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 novembre 2020
Kafka está a tornar-se numa influência regular, mas transportar a deslumbrante simplicidade do escritor da Boémia para o palco complexo deste meio não é fácil. Esta aventura kafkiana é, ironicamente, mais valiosa no que tem a oferecer no design de níveis, jogabilidade e direção artística do que propriamente na narrativa de inspiração literária e abordagem dos temas análogos. O que mais prejudica o jogo é aquilo que é suposto defini-lo: Kafka. O bizarro e o surreal são manejados demasiado timidamente e ancorados com frequência ao mundo concreto do jogo. Metamorphosis não parece uma ideia completa, uma jornada planeada com princípio, meio e fim e uma mensagem firme, mas sim uma ideia engraçada que se perdeu no caminho, preenchendo os vazios entre os seus nódulos mais definidos com improvisações forçadas, o que explica o final abrupto. Apesar das limitações, Metamorphosis é uma boa experiência e navegar o mar de burocracia e absurdismo kafkiano não deixa de ser um prazer devido à jogabilidade entusiasmante e aos visuais atrativos.


Pontos positivos:

+ Plataformas e puzzles de qualidade com possibilidade de exploração.
+ Cenários belos numa escala imersiva bem concebida e com um ótimo design de níveis cheio de verticalidade bem medida.
+ Puzzles variados e missões que requerem um leque de ações bem diferentes. Nunca há monotonia.

Pontos negativos:

- Argumento interessante, mas que falha em explorar os temas kafkianos de forma relevante.
- Caixas de diálogo desengonçadas e erros ortográficos mancham a experiência.
- Apesar da direção artística de topo, vários modelos são insípidos, há texturas menos boas e problemas na oclusão e colisão.


NOTA FINAL: 73/100



https://www.comunidadeculturaearte.com/metamorphosis-kafka-visto-pela-gaveta/
 
Elektrospektrus
449 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 octobre 2020
Metamorphosis to gra silnie inspirowana dwoma opowieściami Franza Kafki pt. "Przemiana" i "Proces". Połączenie obydwu opowieści w jednej grze jest uzasadnione, bo poruszają podobny temat (zagubienia jednostki w świecie totalnych korporacji/państwa), a gra bardzo kreatywnie to wykorzystuje i łączy ze sobą wątki z obu. Przy czym za trzon rozgrywki służy tu historia zaczerpnięta z "Przemiany". Bohaterem tej opowieści jest bowiem zamieniony w robaka komiwojażer Gregor Samsa. A w grze właśnie w tegoż komiwojażera i robaka się wcielamy. Naszym celem, jak można się domyślić, jest odzyskanie dawnej, ludzkiej postaci. Z tego faktu wynika cały pomysł na rozgrywkę - poruszanie się po lokacjach pełnych wielkich (z robaczej perspektywy) mebli, widelców, filiżanek, gramofonów. Wiążą się z tym również mechaniki: biegania, skakania, wspinania się. Jest to pomyślane bardzo kreatywnie, jakby "Przemiana" aż prosiła się o tego typu egranizację.

W tle tych robaczych przygód toczy się natomiast "Proces" Józefa K., który w tej wersji historii jest przyjacielem głównego bohatera. Pomysł na połączenie tych historii jest więc fajny i ma też swoje skutki fabularne, szczególnie w finale gry. Takie hołdowanie Kafce ma też jednak swoje słabsze strony. Bo fabuła sama w sobie nie jest zbyt wciągająca i mimo 2 dostępnych zakończeń, nie satysfakcjonuje. Sytuację ratuje doza humoru, ogólny surrealizm oraz sam fakt, że udało się w tak kreatywny sposób połączyć opowieści Kafki.

Biegając jako robak po biurku możemy więc oglądać i słuchać dziejącą się w tle scenkę między bohaterami "Procesu". Problem jest jednak taki, że mocno to rozprasza i odciąga od "głównego zadania". Bo rozgrywka wymaga nieco skupienia i nie prowadzi gracza za rękę. Mamy tu więc dużo wolności, dróg do celu, które zależą od robaczej zręczności w segmentach platformowych. W razie zgonu (może się zdążyć), mamy bardzo szybki restart do checkpointu. Żebyśmy nie zgubili się na mapce, w każdym momencie możemy oddalić kamerę, aby oglądnąć scenkę która dzieje się w tle lub rozglądnąć - gdzie znajdują się ważne obiekty. To jest dobra rzecz, bo widać też ślady, które po sobie zostawiliśmy (i fajnie pokazuje też skalę - naszego robaka, do wypełnionego meblami pokoju).

Robakiem biega i skacze się naprawdę przyjemnie, od czasu do czasu możemy wspinać się po pionowych powierzchniach (jeśli znajdziemy porozlewane atramenty, miód itp,). Gra ma też przyjemne momenty łamigłówkowe (banalne, ale kreatywne i sensownie wplecione w fabułę). Czasem trzeba skoczyć na pieczątkę, przycisnąć przycisk, pokręcić mechanizmem zegara, albo skleić kabel miodem przyniesionym na odnóżach. Najsłabsze były chyba segmenty "questowe" (znajdź coś/kogoś, zrób coś) w otwartej przestrzeni. Miałem poczucie, że przegapiłem w nich sporo atrakcji, bo choć mapa była fajnie skonstruowana (z perspektywy "mrówki"), to nawigowanie po niej było chaotyczne. Gra ma na przykład swego rodzaju zadania poboczne, ale czasem wykonuje się je przypadkiem, lub przegapia.

Miejscami widać, że budżet Metamorphosis był niewielki. Że historia musiała być skrojona na te ostatecznie 5 godzin rozgrywki. Robacze dialogi (bo w grze można gadać z innymi robaczymi NPCami) to niezbyt przyjemne dla ucha, ale uzasadnione fabularnie szemranie. Niemniej, składa się to wszystko na fajną historię na jeden wieczór, a kafkowski klimat buduje też "operowa" muzyka. Grafika jest całkiem ładna, taka unrealowa - czyli bryły nie do końca ociosane, w pastelowych kolorach, odrealnione (nazwa silnika mówi za siebie). Modele ludzi, zapewne specjalnie tak potraktowano, ale nie przypadły mi do gustu. No i - co ważne, bugów nie uświadczyłem żadnych.

Za 60 ziko polecam, bo fajnie się robakiem biega i widać sporo włożonego serca.

Recommandé
6.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 juillet 2021
Pleasantly surprised
Despite some design flaws (confusing spaces, autosave system), which are in no way game breaking, Metamorphosis is a pretty solid game. Impressive art style, interesting gameplay and a very good story overall. At some points the game pays surprising amounts of attention to detail, so it really pays off to explore and talk to NPCs. Maybe the price tag is a little steep but for some seven, eight euros you're all set for some seven hours of fun.
